content.raw:
It's generally working for me. Some small comments:

* When I right-click links, visuals and collisions on the entity-tree, the context menu shows `Move To`, but choosing it prints an error: `[GUI] [Err] [Scene3D.cc:313] Unable to move to target. Target: 'sphere_visual' not found`. Should we:
    1. Disable the menu for entities which can't be moved to?
    1. Move to those entities (I think it should be possible using their scoped name)

    In either case, as the menu grows bigger, we will probably need different menus for different entity types down the road. Just something to keep in mind.

* It would be more intuitive for the user if the entity which the menu corresponds to were highlighted. I understand that adding a bounding box on the 3D scene is non trivial at this point, but how about highlighting the item on the entity tree?
content.html:
It's generally working for me. Some small comments:

  • When I right-click links, visuals and collisions on the entity-tree, the context menu shows Move To, but choosing it prints an error: [GUI] [Err] [Scene3D.cc:313] Unable to move to target. Target: 'sphere_visual' not found. Should we:

    1. Disable the menu for entities which can't be moved to?
    2. Move to those entities (I think it should be possible using their scoped name)

    In either case, as the menu grows bigger, we will probably need different menus for different entity types down the road. Just something to keep in mind.

  • It would be more intuitive for the user if the entity which the menu corresponds to were highlighted. I understand that adding a bounding box on the 3D scene is non trivial at this point, but how about highlighting the item on the entity tree?

content.raw:
I made changes to support moving to entities using scoped names. I also disabled the menu item for entity types like collisions, sensors, levels that are currently not present on the rendering side. [0dea163](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/commits/0dea163313be08fa286fe0a7b44f25a15392a648)

About highlighting items, I’m thinking about what happens if the user clicks on an entity using the transform tool afterwards. The highlighted item in the entity tree should also be updated. This means we probably need a global event to let all gui plugins know when entity is selected, e.g. through a topic?
content.html:
I made changes to support moving to entities using scoped names. I also disabled the menu item for entity types like collisions, sensors, levels that are currently not present on the rendering side. 0dea163

About highlighting items, I’m thinking about what happens if the user clicks on an entity using the transform tool afterwards. The highlighted item in the entity tree should also be updated. This means we probably need a global event to let all gui plugins know when entity is selected, e.g. through a topic?

content.raw: Yeah makes sense, let's hold on highlighting for a little longer then :ok_hand:
content.html: Yeah makes sense, let's hold on highlighting for a little longer then
